results.title: Attenuation of hypertension-mediated glomerulosclerosis in conjunction with increased angiotensin (1-7).
results.text_hl: While both @CHEMICAL_olmesartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:C437965 @@@olmesartan@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ attenuated @<m>DISEASE_Perivascular_Epithelioid_Cell_Neoplasms</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054973 @@@renal perivascular collagen deposition@@@ (@DISEASE_Collagen_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D003095 @@@PVCD@@@), the greatest effect was observed in SHRs receiving @CHEMICAL_olmesartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:C437965 @@@olmesartan@@@.

citations.NLM: Igase M, Yokoyama H, Ferrario CM. Attenuation of hypertension-mediated glomerulosclerosis in conjunction with increased angiotensin (1-7). Ther Adv Cardiovasc Dis. 2011 Dec;5(6):297-304. PMID: 22089474
